## Introduction

This vignette provides guidance on how to import and export data within the ClinicoPathJamoviModule ecosystem, covering both jamovi and R environments.

## Importing Data into jamovi

jamovi supports various data formats for import. The most common are CSV (Comma Separated Values) and its own `.omv` format.

### From CSV Files

1.  Open jamovi.
2.  Go to `File` > `Open` > `This PC` (or relevant cloud service).
3.  Browse to your CSV file and select it. jamovi will automatically detect delimiters and data types.

### From jamovi (.omv) Files

1.  Open jamovi.
2.  Go to `File` > `Open` > `This PC`.
3.  Select your `.omv` file. These files preserve all analyses and data from a previous jamovi session.

## Importing Data into R

When working directly in R, you can import data using various functions depending on the file format.

### From CSV Files

Use the `read.csv()` function from base R or `read_csv()` from the `readr` package (part of `tidyverse`).

```R
# Using base R
data_csv_base <- read.csv("path/to/your/data.csv")

# Using readr (recommended for better performance and consistency)
# install.packages("readr") # if not already installed
library(readr)
data_csv_readr <- read_csv("path/to/your/data.csv")
```

### From Excel Files (.xlsx, .xls)

Use the `read_excel()` function from the `readxl` package.

```R
# install.packages("readxl") # if not already installed
library(readxl)
data_excel <- read_excel("path/to/your/data.xlsx")
```

### From SPSS, SAS, Stata Files

Use functions from the `haven` package.

```R
# install.packages("haven") # if not already installed
library(haven)

data_spss <- read_spss("path/to/your/data.sav")
data_sas <- read_sas("path/to/your/data.sas7bdat")
data_stata <- read_stata("path/to/your/data.dta")
```

## Exporting Data from jamovi

jamovi allows you to export your data in several formats.

1.  With your data open in jamovi, go to `File` > `Export` > `Data`.
2.  Choose your desired format (e.g., CSV, SPSS, R, SAS, Stata) and specify the file name and location.

## Exporting Data from R

To export data from R to various formats, you can use functions like `write.csv()` or functions from specialized packages.

### To CSV Files

```R
write.csv(your_dataframe, "path/to/save/your_data.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```

### To Excel Files

Use the `write.xlsx()` function from the `openxlsx` package.

```R
# install.packages("openxlsx") # if not already installed
library(openxlsx)
write.xlsx(your_dataframe, "path/to/save/your_data.xlsx")
```
